Posts.Content: I think speaking to someone is a good idea so I will do that. It was just such a relief to know others feel the same. Everyone on this site is so supportive I would’ve been lost without all the advice.
Posts.Title: Restless and feeling guilty about it

Posts.Content: Hi. I’m so glad you posted this. I’ve finished my treatment now (apart from the tamoxifen and zoladex!) but I feel restless. I want something to change but I don’t know what. I have no focus on anything. I work away during the week and go home for the weekend but I don’t want to go back this weekend. I feel like I’m trapped but it’s only come on this week.  This is month 3 if the tamoxifen for me and so far I’ve been lucky with side effects so I have no idea why I feel so strange. Best wishes to everyone Lisa
Posts.Title: Restless and feeling guilty about it

Posts.Content: I haven’t posted before so no idea if this will work. I learnt a lesson about water yesterday. I’d been rushing around at work all morning, no time to drink. Drove to hospital, struggled to park - no time to drink. This was day 2 of radiotherapy. Went back to work feeling like I’d run into a wall I was so tired, had a complete meltdown and got sent home sick. I’m lying in bed feeling sorry for myself. I won’t make that mistake again.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi. I’d read about the side effects and was really worried about starting Tamoxifen but the main factor that convinced me to carry on was the fact that I credit it for keeping my mum alive for 30 years and I hope it does the same for me. I’ve been on them for two months now and so far it’s ok. I’m carrying a bit more fat around the middle and I get a few hot flushes but it’s nowhere near as bad as I thought.  I hope this has helped and I wish you all the best whatever your decision is.
Posts.Title: Refusing Tamoxifen
